bullets.text: U.S. PCE inflation rose to 2.8% in November, moving further from the Fed’s 2% target and complicating rate-cut timing.
Japan inflation cooled to 2.1%, lowest since 2022; Bank of Japan decision and election-sensitive food prices keep policy uncertainty elevated.
House passed final funding bills days before shutdown; Senate consideration reduces near-term fiscal-disruption risk but highlights deep ICE policy splits.
Trump tariff reversal sparked global risk-on rally and renewed “TACO trade” positioning, underscoring policy volatility as a market driver.
TikTok to form a new U.S. entity/joint venture and loosen China ties, aiming to address national-security concerns while preserving U.S. operations.
Greenland talks reportedly include U.S. basing and limits tied to Russia; Greenland PM says sovereignty is a red line, keeping NATO/Arctic tensions high.
Zelenskyy criticized Europe for focusing on managing Trump rather than confronting global threats, signaling growing strain in Ukraine support coordination.
Intel shares fell on soft guidance and manufacturing concerns, highlighting execution risk in advanced-node ramp and competitive pressure in chips.
Capital One agreed to buy Brex for $5.15B, signaling consolidation in fintech credit cards and banks’ push to capture startup and SMB spend.
Robotaxi competition accelerates: Tesla began Austin rides without human safety driver; Waymo opened Miami service, widening U.S. lead in autonomous mobility.
OpenAI chair called AI “probably” a bubble with likely correction; software sell-off may catalyze major M&A as valuations reset.
Europe’s wind and solar generation surpassed fossil fuels, reinforcing structural power-sector decarbonization and shifting energy-security and investment priorities.
EPA revived plan to end animal testing by 2035, potentially expanding alternative methods and reshaping compliance costs for chemicals and pharmaceuticals.
